text: The 1999–2000 Algerian Championnat National was the 38th season of the Algerian Championnat National since its establishment in 1962. A total of 12 teams contested the league, with MC Alger as the defending champions, The Championnat started on 14 October, 1999. and ended on 15 June, 2000. ==Team summaries== === Promotion and relegation === Teams promoted from Algerian Division 2 1999–2000 * ASM Oran * AS Aïn M'lila * USM El Harrach * CS Constantine Teams relegated to Algerian Division 2 2000–2001 * No relegated ==League table== ==Result table== ==Season statistics== ===Top scorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Scorer !Club !Goals |- !|1 |align="left"| Salim Lotfi Sahraoui |align="left"|MO Constantine | style="text-align:center;"|11 |- !|2 |align="left"| Saad Boutaleb |align="left"|CR Belouizdad | style="text-align:center;"|10 |- !|3 |align="left"| Mounir Dob |align="left"|CA Batna | style="text- align:center;"|10 |- !|4 |align="left"| Fares El Aouni |align="left"|WA Tlemcen | style="text-align:center;"|9 |- !|5 |align="left"| Ali Meçabih |align="left"|MC Oran | style="text-align:center;"|9 |- !|6 |align="left"| Billal Zouani |align="left"|USM Blida | style="text-align:center;"|9 |- !|7 |align="left"| Fadel Ryad Settara |align="left"|CR Belouizdad | style="text- align:center;"|7 |- !|8 |align="left"| Ishak Ali Moussa |align="left"|CR Belouizdad | style="text-align:center;"|7 |- !|9 |align="left"| Yacine Amaouche |align="left"|JSM Béjaïa | style="text-align:center;"|6 |- !|10 |align="left"| Hocine Gacemi |align="left"|JS Kabylie | style="text- align:center;"|6 |} ==References== ==External links== *1999–2000 Algerian Championnat National Algerian Championnat National Championnat National Category:Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1 seasons
